title: Practical FPGA-Based DNN Design Debugging and Tuning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of FPGA basic architecture, DNN model development experience, fixed-point data processing concepts
context.additional_context: Workplace-focused training centered on practical skills directly applicable to real-world job tasks for employees.

learning_goals: Perform real-time debugging of DNN (Deep Neural Network) designs on FPGA using OTune overlay-based toolsets.
Implement layer-wise bitwidth optimization for DNNs by analyzing hardware profiling data.

By the end of the four-week course, learners can design an FPGA-based DNN model applicable to edge systems (e.g., autonomous driving sensor nodes) and propose strategies to improve performance by over 20% under given hardware constraints (â‰¤5W power, <50ms latency) by applying at least three adaptive tuning techniques (quantization, pruning, layer merging, etc.).
Verify that fixed-point DNN models achieve accuracy of 96% or higher compared to floating-point models.

resources: FPGA Development Boards (Xilinx/Intel), Overlay Toolset (OTune), Fixed-Point Simulation Tool
Jupyter Notebook-Based Practical Environment, Vitis AI/DNN Compiler
Real-Time Profiling Data Visualization Dashboard Template

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
